result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's demand for disclosure, Motion for discovery and Notice of witness list

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:42 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
